intro: Ouratea stipulacea, commonly known as the velvetleaf ouratea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and showy, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 2 to 5 meters and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its common name. The flowers are followed by small, round, berry-like fruits that contain several seeds.
